reviewText: For me, I enjoyed all three movies, especially "deceived", a real chiller, but for the deaf in my family, worthless, she so wanted to enjoy "deceived", it was impossible, have any of you ever tried to explain a movie you are watching to a deaf person?, try it, it's not easy, nor is it fun,it will ruin the movie for you, I am going to find out the agency that controls handicap accessibility and register a complaint.

reviewText: These are three great movies at an excellent price, I just don't see how you can loose. I ordered this DVD for "The Rich Man's Wife " and was very fortunate to like the other two as well.

reviewText: Deceived is one of the best mysteries I've ever seen, but not well received because everyone expects Goldie Hawn to be funny.  Teh Rich Man's Wife also an entertaining mystery with a little twist.  Son of Sam left me cold, but if you like blood & gore, it's for you.  I'm not sure why they put these 3 movies together, but in order to get Deceived, I had to order the triple feature.

reviewText: Deceived is one of the best movies if you like Goldie Hawn.  Also the other two are good as well.  Very good price for all three movies.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Deceived was the best film in this trio.  Goldie Hawn was very convincing as the woman who fell in love with a man whom she really didn't know at all.  The Rich Man's Wife, starring Halle Berry, had a few twists and turns that kept my attention.  But Summer of Sam---I don't know about that one.  If it was about The Son of Sam, the serial killer who terrorized the city of New York, then it missed its point.  The killer was only a subplot in this mishmash of a movie.  It's probably my least favorite Spike Lee film.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I only ordered this movie set because I wanted Deceived.  But after watching the other two movies, I'm very happy I got it.  The vendor sent it right away and it was brand new and a good price.  I would buy from this vendor again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Deceived",starring Goldie Hawn & John Hurt is a fantastic thriller, which I could only find alone for about $16, so I bought this for about $5. "The Rich Man's Wife" was just boring, "Summer of Sam" was, for all it's good reviews, crap. But, to get "Deceived" for less than a third makes it it well worth the purchase. Goldie Hawn is great in what I believe her first and only non-comedy role. I highly recommend it!
summary: It Is Worth Buying for "Deceived" Alone!

reviewText: Even though Deceived and The Rich Man's Wife are okay films, i primarily made this purchase for Summer of Sam, as I am a huge Spike Lee fan and my older copy of SoS was scratched beyond play. The quality of the picture and sound seemed comparable, but the aspect ratio was slightly off on widescreen. The casually viewer might not notice, but as I have seen this particular film upwards of 20 times, it certainly stuck out to me. As well, there were no subtitles to be found, but I guess that's to be expected on such a budget release.
Title: N/A
